alert.note: Alert for Brown (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 18 at 4:45PM EDT until July 18 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wilmington has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Mason County in northern Kentucky... Robertson County in northern Kentucky... Bracken County in northern Kentucky... Southeastern Pendleton County in northern Kentucky... Southeastern Brown County in southwestern Ohio... * Until 530 PM EDT. * At 445 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Falmouth, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Maysville, Falmouth, Washington, Ripley, Aberdeen, Augusta, Lewisburg, Brooksville, Dover, Germantown, Browning Corner, Murphysville, Stonewall, Powersville, South Ripley, Chatham, Tuckahoe, Hittville, Minerva and US Route 62 at State Route 875. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
